businessSummary.oneLiner: Beyond EVs ‚Äî the world's largest EV maker undergoing a transformative pivot to autonomous robotaxis, humanoid robots, and energy storage as a 'Physical AI platform company.'
businessSummary.description: Tesla is rapidly transforming from an EV manufacturer into an integrated AI, robotics, and energy platform company. FY2025 revenue was $94.8B, marking the first-ever annual revenue decline (-3%), with net income plunging 61%. However, on February 17, the first production Cybercab unit rolled off the line at Giga Texas, bringing the robotaxi era closer to reality, and FSD cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion. Meanwhile, safety concerns around the robotaxi service have emerged (Fortune reported a crash rate 4x that of human drivers), alongside a California DMV settlement to stop Autopilot marketing and a $243M jury verdict being upheld ‚Äî regulatory and legal risks are simultaneously escalating. Model S/X discontinuation is confirmed for Q2 2026, and the Fremont line is being converted to an Optimus robot factory.
howTheyMakeMoney: Vehicle Sales: ~73% of revenue ($69.5B). Model 3/Y as core lineup, Model S/X confirmed for Q2 2026 discontinuation
Energy Business: ~14% of revenue ($12.8B, +27% YoY). Megapack large-scale energy storage systems. 46.7 GWh deployed in 2025 (+48% YoY)
Services/Other: ~13% of revenue ($12.5B). Supercharger network, insurance, maintenance, parts
FSD Subscription: $99/month autonomous driving software (transitioned to subscription-only in February, a key future revenue driver)
keyProducts: Model 3/Y (core EV lineup, JD Power 2026 EV satisfaction #1 and #2)
Cybertruck (electric pickup, lower-priced AWD at $59,990 launched 2/20)
Cybercab (autonomous robotaxi, first production unit rolled off 2/17, $30,000)
Optimus (humanoid robot, Fremont factory targeting 1M units/year, v3 unveil expected Q1)
Megapack (large-scale energy storage, 46.7 GWh deployed in 2025, Megapack 3 production upcoming)
FSD (Full Self-Driving, 8.2B cumulative miles, subscription-only since February)

keyMetrics.name: P/E Ratio
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on TTM EPS of $1.08. Extremely elevated, pricing in future AI, robotics, and autonomous driving value. Over 10x the auto industry average

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Even on 2026 estimated EPS of $2.25, approaching 200x. Difficult to justify without Cybercab and Optimus monetization

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth
keyMetrics.interpretation: First-ever annual revenue decline, with $108.9B+ projected this year. Automotive -11% partially offset by Energy +27%

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Q4 2025 gross margin declined to 18.03%. Net income $3.79B (YoY -46%). At auto industry average (4.47%) levels

keyMetrics.name: FCF (Free Cash Flow)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Operating cash flow $14.75B minus CapEx $8.53B. Cash generation recovering but falls short of the $20B+ investment plan for 2026

keyMetrics.name: Debt-to-Equity (D/E)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Cash $44.06B vs. debt $14.72B. Net cash of $29.34B ($7.82 per share). Excellent financial health

growthDrivers.title: Cybercab Production Begins ‚Äî The Robotaxi Era Opens
growthDrivers.description: On February 17, the first production Cybercab unit ‚Äî with no steering wheel or pedals ‚Äî rolled off the line at Giga Texas. Priced at $30,000, full-rate production is expected to begin in April, with plans to expand robotaxi service to 9 U.S. cities in the first half of 2026. Musk has warned initial production will be 'painfully slow.'

growthDrivers.title: FSD Surpasses 8.2 Billion Miles + Subscription-Only Transition
growthDrivers.description: FSD Supervised cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion, adding 1 billion miles in just the first 50 days of 2026. Starting February 14, the one-time purchase option ($8,000) was eliminated in favor of a $99/month subscription-only model, building a recurring revenue stream. FSD v14.2.2.5 features an upgraded vision encoder.

growthDrivers.title: Optimus Robot ‚Äî Fremont Factory Conversion, 1M Units/Year Target
growthDrivers.description: Following Model S/X discontinuation (Q2 2026), the Fremont production line is being converted to an Optimus humanoid robot factory. Gen 3 production started January 21, with 1,000+ units currently operating in factories. v3 prototype unveil expected in Q1. A 10M unit/year factory is also planned at Giga Texas.

growthDrivers.title: 2026 Revenue to Surpass $100B + High-Growth Energy Business
growthDrivers.description: Consensus projects 2026 revenue growth of +15%, surpassing $100B for the first time. The energy storage business deployed 46.7 GWh (+48% YoY) in 2025, with Megapack 3 production upcoming. Powerwall 3P launched in Germany.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Dominates the U.S. EV market with 50%+ share but has ceded the global #1 position to BYD. Vertical integration spanning software, manufacturing, and energy, plus 8.2 billion miles of autonomous driving data, form the core moat.

moats.description: 8.2 billion FSD Supervised miles (including 3 billion urban miles) of real-world driving data. An overwhelming data asset for autonomous driving training versus competitors. Growth rate is exponential.
In-house development spanning batteries (4680), custom chips (D1/HW4), software (FSD), and charging infrastructure (Supercharger). Expanding into robotics and energy.
Supercharger connector (NACS) adopted as the North American EV charging standard. Competitors including GM, Ford, and Rivian depend on Tesla's charging network.

competitors.name: BYD
competitors.detail: 2025 global EV sales leader (2.26M units, +28%). 35% China market share. U.S. entry limited by regulations

competitors.name: Waymo (Alphabet)
competitors.detail: Raised $16B in funding, $126B valuation. 400K+ rides/week, 127M autonomous miles. Expanding to 20 cities

competitors.name: Rivian (RIVN)
competitors.detail: R2 SUV ($45,000) launching 2026 as direct Model Y competitor. Under 200K annual units

competitors.name: GM
competitors.detail: ~13% U.S. EV share, growing rapidly. Diverse model lineup on Ultium platform

recentNews.headline: Motley Fool: 'Why Tesla Is Discontinuing the Model S and X' ‚Äî Fremont Converting to Optimus Factory
recentNews.significance: Model S/X discontinuation confirmed for Q2 2026. Fremont line converting to Optimus production targeting 1M units/year. A symbolic decision marking Tesla's 'Physical AI' transformation.

recentNews.headline: Cybertruck Lower-Priced AWD at $59,990 + Cyberbeast Price Cut by $15,000
recentNews.significance: Aggressive pricing amid demand weakness. The lower-priced variant offers dual-motor AWD with 325-mile range. Cyberbeast cut by $15,000. Musk stated the pricing is 'valid for 10 days only.'

recentNews.headline: Tesla Robotaxi Crash Rate 4x Higher Than Human Drivers ‚Äî 1 Crash Per 57,000 Miles
recentNews.significance: Fortune reports 14 crashes across 800K cumulative miles. Raises safety concerns for the robotaxi business, a core growth narrative. Waymo also intensifying competition with $16B in funding.

recentNews.headline: California DMV Settlement: Tesla to Stop Using 'Autopilot' Marketing ‚Äî Avoids 30-Day Sales Suspension
recentNews.significance: Agreed to drop 'Autopilot' branding in California, the largest market. Avoided a 30-day sales suspension, but autonomous driving marketing regulations are becoming reality.

recentNews.headline: First Production Cybercab Unit Rolls Off Line at Giga Texas ‚Äî $30,000 Price Confirmed
recentNews.significance: First production unit of the fully autonomous robotaxi with no steering wheel or pedals completed. Full-rate production starting in April, with plans to expand to 9 cities in H1 2026.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Average target of $396 (Hold) across 33 analysts implies -3.7% downside from the current price. Street high $600 (Wedbush), Baird Outperform $548 (new initiation), Goldman Sachs lowered from $420 to $405. The rare situation of consensus trading below the current price highlights extreme divergence between market pricing and analyst assessments.

risks.title: Robotaxi Safety Concerns ‚Äî 4x Human Crash Rate, Intensifying Waymo Competition
risks.description: Fortune reports a crash rate of 1 per 57,000 miles (14 crashes across 800K miles), 4x higher than human drivers. Meanwhile, Waymo raised $16B ($126B valuation), delivers 400K+ rides/week, and is expanding to 20 cities.

risks.title: Musk/DOGE Political Risk + Plunging European Sales + Key Executive Departures
risks.description: Musk's political activities (DOGE) are driving European sales declines (Norway -88%, Netherlands -67%). Key executive departures and an xAI $2B shareholder lawsuit are also ongoing.

risks.title: Extreme Valuation ‚Äî P/E 407x, Trading Above Consensus Target
risks.description: P/E of 407x, Forward P/E of 198x prices in flawless execution. The 33-analyst consensus ($396) sits below the current price ($411), with $20B+ CapEx burden in 2026 adding pressure.

risks.title: Core EV Business Structural Weakness ‚Äî First-Ever Annual Revenue Decline
risks.description: FY2025 annual revenue -3% (first ever), automotive segment -11%, vehicle deliveries -9%. Q4 net income -46%. Price cut strategy pressures margins, making automotive profitability recovery uncertain.

risks.title: Cybertruck Demand Weakness ‚Äî Price Cuts Becoming Necessary
risks.description: Responding with the lower-priced AWD launch and Cyberbeast $15,000 cut, but weak demand in the electric pickup market is the fundamental issue.

buyReasons.title: Physical AI Platform Transformation ‚Äî Cybercab Production + Optimus + FSD Subscription
buyReasons.rationale: First Cybercab production unit completed, full-rate production in April, expanding to 9 cities. Optimus Gen 3 production started, v3 unveil expected Q1, targeting 1M units/year. FSD $99/month subscription transition builds a recurring revenue model.

buyReasons.title: Net Cash of $29.3B Provides Strong Financial Firepower + High-Growth Energy Business
buyReasons.rationale: D/E of 0.18, net cash of $29.3B ‚Äî industry-leading financial health. Energy segment deployed 46.7 GWh (+48% YoY) in 2025. 2026 revenue projected to surpass $100B.

buyReasons.title: FSD 8.2 Billion Miles Data Moat + Claimed 12-Year Lead Over Competitors
buyReasons.rationale: FSD Supervised 8.2 billion cumulative miles (CES 2026 analysis: 12-year lead over competitors). Subscription model transition accelerates monetization. Potential for autonomous driving market dominance amid a regulatory easing backdrop.

overallOpinion: Cybercab first production + FSD 8.2B miles make the robotaxi a reality, but a 4x human crash rate (Fortune) and Waymo's $16B raise intensify competition
P/E 407x with consensus target ($396) below the current price ($411) ‚Äî extreme divergence between AI premium and fundamental valuation
Below 50-day SMA ($429), DOGE participation driving European sales collapse, and key executive departures add headwinds
April Cybercab full-rate production and Optimus v3 Q1 unveil are the key H1 catalysts
Whether robotaxi safety data improves will be the watershed for long-term investment conviction

sources.name: CNBC ‚Äî Tesla Q4 2025 Earnings
sources.description: Q4 2025 revenue $24.9B, net income -46%, annual revenue -3%

TechCrunch ‚Äî Tesla Energy Fastest Growing
